name: Study on GitHub pages
body:
### What are github pages
GitHub Pages are public webpages **freely** hosted and **easily** published through GitHub site.
See [Github pages intro](https://help.github.com/articles/what-are-github-pages/).

hello world.

### Highlights
1. Free. It's not only $ free but also structure free.
2. Easy to set up. Takes less than 10min to build your own page. 
3. Easy to edit. Allows you to use markup language to author content (e.g. markdown, html.)
4. Easy to apply templates. Support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator.

### Downsides
1. No localization supported.
2. Not *easy* for ppl who're not familiar with Git, markdown, html.
3. For people who only cares about content, the process like setting up requirement, sending pull request, solve merge conflict, etc. might be an overhead.

### Samples
[Sample page for user or organization](https://github.com/jekyll/jekyll/wiki/sites)  
[Sample page for project introduction](http://dragonbones.effecthub.com/)  

### Demo
You are already seeing the demo for project introduction!  
[Click here to see product details](http://norliu.github.io/testpage.html)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
